channel.title: Stata on Gradon Nicholls
channel.description: Recent content in Stata on Gradon Nicholls

item.title: How Influential Are Music Critics?
item.description: I gave this presentation on December 6, 2021 as part of the course SURV727 “Fundamentals of Cmputing and Data Display.” I use R for data collection, and then clean and analyze the data in Stata. My data science experience grew quickly and greatly during this course, and I had a lot of fun combing various sources of data involving API’s from Spotify, Last.FM, Wikipedia, and Google, and using web scraping techniques to obtain review scores from Wikipedia.

item.title: ksmirnovk: Stata Program for Performing a k-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov Test
item.description: Here is some Stata code I produced back in 2017. A colleague asked how to perform a k-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test in Stata, and I was surprised to find that it is not widely implemented. I was more surpised to discover that such a test was developed back in 1959 by J Kiefer. I thought it would be straightforward to implement the test given Kiefer’s formula–all we need is a test statistic and and a CDF.
